abstract: American fertility rates have fallen noticeably in the last few years, a trend that seems to be tied to the poor economy, according to an analysis from the Pew Research Center.
snippet: American fertility rates have fallen noticeably in the last few years, a trend that seems to be tied to the poor economy, according to an analysis from the Pew Research Center.
lead_paragraph: American birth rates have fallen noticeably in the last few years, a trend that seems to be tied to the poor economy, according to a new analysis from the Pew Research Center.

headline.main: Fewer Births in a Bad Economy
